metadata.title: Custom Post-Processors - Extending
metadata.description:
Packer Post-processors are the components of Packer that transform one artifact
into another, for example by compressing files, or uploading them.

mdxSource.compiledSource:

those files, and returning an artifact with a single ID: the URL of the upload.`),mdx("p",null,`Post-processor plugins implement the `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/hashicorp/packer-plugin-sdk/packer#PostProcessor"},mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"a"},`packer.PostProcessor`)),` interface and are

`,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"https://github.com/mitchellh/mapstructure"},`mapstructure`),` library is
recommended. Mapstructure will take an `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`interface{}`),` and decode it into an
arbitrarily complex struct. If there are any errors, it generates very
human-friendly errors that can be returned directly from the configure method.`),mdx("p",null,`While it is not actively enforced, `,mdx("strong",{parentName:"p"},`no side effects`),` should occur from
running the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`Configure`),` method. Specifically, don't create files, don't create

PostProcess is
responsible for taking one `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`packer.Artifact`),` implementation, and transforming
it into another.
A `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`PostProcess`),` call can be cancelled at any moment. Cancellation is triggered

metadata.title: Packer by HashiCorp
metadata.description: Packer helps you create golden images for multiple platforms from a single source configuration.

integrationsConfig.description: A curated collection of official, partner, and community Packer Integrations.
